briefTitle: Combined Liraglutide and Metformin Therapy in Women With Previous Gestational Diabetes Mellitus (GDM)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adult female 18 years to 45 years of age who experienced GDM within 52 weeks of index pregnancy
* Actual BMI \>25 kg/ m2
* Written consent for participation in the study
* Patient completed lactation
* Dysglycemia (impaired fasting glucose \[IFG}, impaired glucose tolerance \[IGT} or IFG/IGT) and/or ß-cell dysfunction postpartum requiring pharmacological intervention (except type 1 or 2 diabetes)

Exclusion Criteria:

Personal or family history of medullary thyroid carcinoma or in patients with Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia syndrome type 2

* History of pancreatitis
* Significant cardiovascular, cerebrovascular, renal, or hepatobiliary diseases in the past (viral hepatitis, toxic hepatic damage, jaundice of unknown etiology)
* Serum liver enzymes (AST and/or ALT levels) exceeding more than twice normal laboratory values
* Uncontrolled hypertension (systolic blood pressure\>150 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure \>90 mm Hg)
* Fasting serum triglycerides ≥800 mg/dl at screening. Lipid-lowering medications must have been maintained at the same dose for 3 months prior to enrollment
* Hematological profiles considered to be clinically significant
* Cholestasis during the past pregnancy
* Presence of contradictions for GLP-1 receptor agonist or metformin administration such as allergy or hypersensitivity
* Current use of metformin, thiazolidinediones, dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitors or GLP-1 receptor agonist medications.
* Use of drugs known to exacerbate glucose tolerance.
* Use of prescription or over-the-counter weight-loss drugs
* Diabetes postpartum or history of diabetes or prior use of medications to treat diabetes except gestational diabetes
* Creatinine clearance less than 60 ml/min
* History or currently undergoing chemotherapy or radiotherapy for cancer
* Pregnancy planned during the coming two years
* Currently breastfeeding
* Exclusion criteria include any condition, which in the opinion of the investigator would place the subject at increased risk or otherwise make the subject unsuitable for participation in the study

outcomeMeasures.title: Insulin Secretion-Sensitivity Index (IS-SI)
outcomeMeasures.description: IS-SI in liraglutide-metformin (LIRA-MET) therapy compared to metformin alone (PLacebo-MET)

outcomeMeasures.title: Fasting Blood Glucose (FBG)
outcomeMeasures.description: Fasting glucose levels in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Glucose During OGTT (MBG)
outcomeMeasures.description: MBG derived from average glucose measured during OGTT in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Homeostasis Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
outcomeMeasures.description: HOMA-IR, a measure of insulin resistance derived from fasting values, in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Matsuda Insulin Sensitivity Index Derived From OGTT
outcomeMeasures.description: OGTT- derived insulin sensitivity index in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Insulinogenic Index (IGI) /HOMA-IR
outcomeMeasures.description: IGI/HOMA-IR, a measure of early insulin response corrected by fasting insulin resistance, in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Absolute Body Weight
outcomeMeasures.description: Body weight in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to End of Study (Expressed as % Compared to Baseline)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight from baseline to end o f study in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group. The number was derived from final weight minus baseline and normalized to a percent.

outcomeMeasures.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
outcomeMeasures.description: BMI, a measure of total body adiposity, in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Waist Circumference (WC)
outcomeMeasures.description: Waist size (measure of truncal adiposity) with LIRA-MET compared to PL-MET

outcomeMeasures.title: Waist-to-Hip Ratio (WHR)
outcomeMeasures.description: Waist circumference divided by hip circumference (a measure of central adiposity) in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Waist to Height Ratio (WHtR)
outcomeMeasures.description: Waist circumference divided by height (measure of body fat distribution) in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Total Cholesterol (CHOL) Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: CHOL levels in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: High Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: HDL-C levels in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: LDL-Cholesterol levels in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Triglyceride (TRG) Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: TRG concentrations in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Triglyceride to High Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Ratio TRG/HDL-C)
outcomeMeasures.description: TRG/HDL-Cholesterol levels in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Systolic Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: SBP in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Diastolic Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: DBP in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) Levels
outcomeMeasures.description: Hepatic enzyme, ALT, associated with insulin resistance, in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
outcomeMeasures.description: The hepatic marker, AST, associated with insulin resistance in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group

outcomeMeasures.title: Alanine Aminotransferase /Aspartate Aminotransferase (ALT/AST) Ratio
outcomeMeasures.description: ALT/AST ratio, used to assess liver function in LIRA-MET group compared with PL-MET group
